question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
Since \(0 \leq 1+\sin x \leq 2\) for all x, we use the integral comparison test to see that

\[\begin{aligned} \int_1^{\infty} \frac{1+\sin x} {x^{2}} dx \leq \int_1^{\infty} \frac2{x^2}\,dx\end{aligned}\]

The latter integral converges, by the integral p test (with p = 2). Hence, again by the integral comparison test, the former integral also converges.
sols_latex:

comparison test to see that

\begin{align*}
\int_1^{\infty} \frac{1+\sin x} {x^{2}} dx \leq \int_1^{\infty} \frac2{x^2}\,dx
\end{align*}

The latter integral converges, by the integral \emph{p} test (with
\emph{p} = 2). Hence, again by the integral comparison test, the former
integral also \textbf{converges}.
